definitions.definition: A 45 RPM vinyl record with one song on side A and one on side B.
A popular song released and sold (on any format) nominally on its own though usually having at least one extra track.
definitions.example: The Offspring released four singles from their most recent album.

definitions.definition: One who is not married or does not have a romantic partner.
definitions.example: He went to the party, hoping to meet some friendly singles there.

definitions.definition: A score of one run.
A hit in baseball where the batter advances to first base.
A tile that has a different value (i.e. number of pips) at each end.
A bill valued at $1.
definitions.example: I don't have any singles, so you'll have to make change.

definitions.definition: A one-way ticket.
A score of one point, awarded when a kicked ball is dead within the non-kicking team's end zone or has exited that end zone. Officially known in the rules as a rouge.
(chiefly in the plural) A game with one player on each side, as in tennis.
One of the reeled filaments of silk, twisted without doubling to give them firmness.
A handful of gleaned grain.
A floating-point number having half the precision of a double-precision value.
To identify or select one member of a group from the others; generally used with out, either to single out or to single (something) out.
definitions.example: Eddie singled out his favorite marble from the bag.

definitions.definition: To get a hit that advances the batter exactly one base.
definitions.example: Pedro singled in the bottom of the eighth inning, which, if converted to a run, would put the team back into contention.

definitions.definition: To thin out.
(of a horse) To take the irregular gait called singlefoot.
To sequester; to withdraw; to retire.
To take alone, or one by one.
Not accompanied by anything else; one in number.
definitions.example: Can you give me a single reason not to leave right now?

definitions.definition: Not divided in parts.
definitions.example: The potatoes left the spoon and landed in a single big lump on the plate.

definitions.definition: Designed for the use of only one.
Performed by one person, or one on each side.
Not married or (in modern times) not involved in a romantic relationship without being married or not dating anyone exclusively.
definitions.example: Forms often ask if a person is single, married, divorced or widowed. In this context, a person who is dating someone but who has never married puts "single".

definitions.definition: Having only one rank or row of petals.
Simple and honest; sincere, without deceit.
Uncompounded; pure; unmixed.
Simple; foolish; weak; silly.
